com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget

Interface SmartViewExtension<ViewClass extends android.view.View>

  • Type Parameters:
    ViewClass - the View class the extension is applied on
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SmartFrameLayout, SmartImageView, SmartLinearLayout, SmartRelativeLayout, SmartViewExtension.ViewExtensionDelegate

    public interface SmartViewExtension<ViewClass extends android.view.View>
    An interface introduced in order to get notified when a container size changes, because there is no OnSizeChangedListener in Android View, whereas there is a View#onSizeChanged() method.

    In addition, this interface for disabling the View.requestLayout() method dynamically.

    Since:
    2013.06.06
    Author:
    Édouard Mercier

    • Method Detail

      • getRatio

        float getRatio()
        Returns:
        the vertical/horizontal ratio ; when set to 0, no ratio is applied setRatio(float)
        See Also:
        setRatio(float)

      • setRatio

        void setRatio(float ratio)
        Sets the ratio between the width and the height of the image. The default value is 9 / 16.

        • When set to a positive value, the image width is taken as a reference to force the height.
        • When set to a negative value, the image height is taken as a reference to force the width, and the ratio argument absolute value is taken.

        Parameters:
        ratio - when set to 0, no ratio is applied
        See Also:
        getRatio()

      • setMaxWidth

        void setMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Sets the widget maximum width. Defaults to Integer#MAX_VALUE. A #requestLayout() is required for the new value to take effect.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - the new widget maximum width
        See Also:
        setMaxHeight(int)

      • setMaxHeight

        void setMaxHeight(int maxHeight)
        Sets the widget maximum height. Defaults to Integer#MAX_VALUE. A #requestLayout() is required for the new value to take effect.
        Parameters:
        maxHeight - the new widget maximum height
        See Also:
        setMaxWidth(int)

      • getOnSizeChangedListener

        OnSizeChangedListener<ViewClass> getOnSizeChangedListener()
        Returns:
        the currently registered interface which listens for the widget size changes events ; is null by default

      • setOnSizeChangedListener

        void setOnSizeChangedListener(OnSizeChangedListener<ViewClass> onSizeChangedListener)
        Sets the interface that will be invoked when the widget size changes.
        Parameters:
        onSizeChangedListener - may be null, and in that case, no interface will be notified

      • isRequestLayoutDisabled

        boolean isRequestLayoutDisabled()
        The default value of the underlying flag is false.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the #requestLayout() method execution should do nothing
        See Also:
        #setRequestLayoutEnabled(boolean)

      • setRequestLayoutDisabled

        void setRequestLayoutDisabled(boolean requestLayoutDisabled)
        Indicates that the view #requestLayout() method execution should do nothing (not invoking the parent method).

        This feature is especially useful used in combination with the Gallery widget, which causes flickering issues when updating the widgets inside a ViewGroup.

        Parameters:
        requestLayoutDisabled - when set to true, the #requestLayout() will not invoke its parent method, and hence will do nothing

      • onSuperMeasure

        void onSuperMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec,
                  int heightMeasureSpec)
        Is responsible for invoking the underlying View#onMeasure() super method.

      • setSelfMeasuredDimension

        void setSelfMeasuredDimension(int measuredWidth,
                            int measuredHeight)
        Is responsible for invoking the underlying View#setMeasuredDimension() method.
